page.title: 07BRIGHTLINGSEA TOY FACTORY
page.content: The toy factory was started as a cottage industry in 1960 by Susan Wynter.The business earns its income by constructing educational toys for the blind,handicapped,and pre_school children,such as dolls houses,building kits,and jigsaws.These toys are made from different woods,hard beech from Romania,soft pine from the U.K,plywood from Russia,and a compacted paper board,called Medite from Ireland. 12 men work in the factory,and the company has recently combined with a firm in Southend. The wood is kept with care so it does not warp.In the process of toy-making the wood is ripped,planed,sanded,and then sprayed with non-toxic paints,and decorated by hot foil pressing,or silk screen printing.The toys are sold to companies in Britain,such as Galt,and also firms in America.
